data.title: Cave dwellers on laptops
data.text: This particular location feels dark and dreary for me. As soon as I enter, I hope there is no line and I can get out with my coffee. There are, on the other hand, many that love this place and appear to make it a second home; they hover over their laptops, typing away, as their half-calf decaf light saccharine latte with chocolate sprinkles coffee goes cold. While they enjoy the cave and their virtual life, I escape to reality to smell fresh air with my large Starbucks strong coffee! We do all love the coffee (although it'd be nice to enjoy in a real cup versus recycled paper).

data.title: always a Great Cup of Coffee
data.text:
Starbucks hands down is always a stop for us. We try Starbucks in all the towns we visit & have yet to be disappointed. My wife "Miss Mary" & I always go for machiatto 
, latte or flavored coffee. Our favorite coffee shop is Starbucks!

data.title: Starbucks
data.text: I love starbucks!!  They have great coffee, snacks and its a great atmosphere.  They have free wifi to use for computers, tablets and phones.  Its a great hangout can sit, read books, etc.

data.title: GOOD SERVICE
data.text: I had a grande latte with skim milk. It was very good. Service was friendly and efficient.  The place wasn't crowded. Most of the customers were self-absorbed as they hunched over their computers, taking advantage of the free WiFi. Very unfriendly.

data.title: good coffee
data.text: frappuccino is great, wished there were more milf substitute options than soy milk. But the atmosphere is great and free wifi is good also.

data.title: Busy Location
data.text:
This Starbucks is a busy, popular location near Las Olas Blvd. first off parking is difficult at this location as there is just a small shared parking lot.
I find the lines are long here and they seem to move slow. Also several times I've been in here and people who haven't ordered a coffee are sound asleep on the comfortable chairs, not allowing true customers to have a place to sit!
Once you do get your order it's the true Starbucks good quality and taste. This location just is busy and seems to move slow.

data.title: It's fine, if you're just coming in & out for a drink.
data.text:
My boyfriend and I were studying together & picked this location randomly one day. We're used to all the coffee machine noise & talking from other people while studying at other Starbucks locations, but this was just not a good place to study. It's small which makes it fine for an easy in & out, grab a drink type of visit. 

But holy baristas. Maybe mine was having a rough day cause she was just not very friendly. What I order is not on the menu but a majority of locations know what I'm talking about or suggest different things. She was just not understanding me & told me to never say that again when ordering, literally.

data.title: Get yout java here
data.text: This downtown location let's you load up on a latte and stroll to Las Olas on the other side of the bridge. Parking is horrid, but circle around and give it a minute!

data.title: Starbucks in the 1925 center of Broward County
data.text:
Typically a busy location, I don't frequent the Southeast corner of Broward Blvd and Federal Highway for this very reason.  With that said, I was at this particular Starbucks recently when Florida Governor Rick Scott made an appearance for about 40 minutes while visiting Fort Lauderdale.

Interesting note - the location of this Starbucks was the geographic center of Broward County in 1925.

Four-star rating for outstanding customer service and an overall clean place.

I was impressed that the Baristas remembered my signature drink - a "Bill's Morning Start" - a six-shot Venti, four-pump Vanilla, one-pump Mocha, extra-fat, extra-hot, upside down latte.  

Free wi-fi, although slow at time, but who can complain with free.  Coffee and service is consistently good.  This location does not have a drive-thru for those on the run.

/s/ William E. Lewis Jr, Davie, Cooper City, Fort Lauderdale, and Vero Beach, Florida

data.title: The Starbucks on Las Olas is much better
data.text: I walked here one morning from the Riverside Hotel where I was staying. It is about a twenty-minute walk. This Starbucks is located right across the highway from Morton's Steakhouse. The highway is rather difficult and dangerous to cross. The coffee here was average Starbucks coffee in coffee quality.  The floors were dirty and greasy. They were out of half and half. Not enough tables and chairs. Baristas were courteous and efficient.  The Starbucks on Las Olas is much better.

data.title: Siempre es un rico cafe
data.text: Como en todos los locales de esta cadena es un placer tomarse un café acompañado de un cupcakes y en esta ciudad

data.title: cafe y wi fi gratis
data.text:
Para desyunar en una ambiente tranquilo, disfrutando del tipico cafe y con wi fi gratis.
El lugar es agradable y las opciones de cookies son muchas.

data.title: Um café sempre vai bem
data.text: Tomar um suco ou um bom café, usar o banheiro e aproveitar um pouco de sua Wifi grátis estão entre os pontos altos dessa rede espalhada por todo planeta.

data.title: Wifi gratis!
data.text: O Starbucks, além de oferecer wifi grátis, tem muitas opções pra se tomar café da manhã e vive lotado.O preço não é dos mais baratos mas consegue-se fazer uma refeição um pouco mais parecida com o que comemos aqui no Brasil.

data.title: BOM CAFÉ
data.text: Lugar para tomar um bom café, como em todas as unidades da rede e comer rápido pagando pouco. Sempre uma boa pedida.
